title: Opportunity
content:
Â 

Â  Â 

The Digital Heart Lab (DHlab) in the Department of Biomedical Engineering,
National University of Singapore (NUS) has multiple openings for Postdoc, PhD
students, and visitors. Our lab is committed to interdisciplinary research at
the intersection of AI, cardiac modeling, and medical image analysis.

About Us

DHlab is affiliated in the NUS, which is an internationally renowned research
university, ranked 8th in the QS World University Rankings 2025. We aim to
develop advanced AI models for creating cardiac digital twins, i.e.,
personalized virtual heart models. We will employ the dataset (imaging, ECG,
electronic medical records, etc) collected from patients, to accurately
modelling the anatomy and simulate the function of patients' diseased hearts.
These models, coupled with machine learning techniques, contribute to the
identification of crucial mechanistic relationships and features that offer
insights into the trajectory of a patient's heart condition. The research will
delve into the intersection of AI and cardiac sciences, exploring novel
approaches to revolutionize our understanding of the human heart. With the
potential to impact medical treatments and technology advancements, it promises
an exciting and important avenue for personalized medicine. We will collaborate
with a multi-disciplinary team, including academics/ experts from NUS,
University of Oxford, Peking University, Imperial College London, Fudan
University, etc.

Research Areas

 * Medical Image Analysis
   
   * Aim: create 3D(+t) anatomical model from medical imaging.
   * Tech: image segmentation, registration, motion extraction, mesh
     reconstruction, etc.

 * Electrophysiological Modelling
   
   * Aim: simulate and inverse infer the electrical activity in the heart.
   * Tech: mathematics modelling, signal processing, inverse inference, etc.

 * Machine Learning
   
   * Aim: establish AI models to advance cardiac modelling and simulation.
   * Tech: multi-modal AI, neural surrogate model, physics-informed model, etc.

 * Cardiac Digital Twin Application
   
   * Aim: employ the cardiac digital twins to assiss the personalized diagnosis
     and treatment of atrial fibrillation (AF), myocardial infarction (MI),
     ventricle tachycardia (VT), hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM), etc.
   * Tech: clinical evaluation, platform development, interactive system, etc

 * Cross-Organ Digital Twin Platform
   
   * Aim: extend cardiac digital twin framework to multi-organ systems (eyes,
     liver, brain, etc.) for systemic disease modeling and treatment planning.
   
   * Tech: mathmatical modeling, multi-physics simulation, cross-modal AI
     integration, and unified clinical visualization platform, etc.

Postdoc Opening Details

 * Requirement
   
   * Hold a PhD degree in biomedical engineering, computer science, data
     science, applied statistics/ mathematics, or any-related field.
   * Strong publication record and related research experience.
   * Candidates with cardiac modeling and simulation experience are preferred.

 * Salary
   
   * The competitive salary (~5500 SGD per month) is provided with NUS benefits,
     which can be discussed if you are exceptionally excellent.

 * How To Apply
   
   * Please send your CV, 1-2 page research statement, papers, and any other
     supporting materials, to lilei.sky@outlook.com. Email subject can be
     "Postdoc Application - Your University - Your Name".
   * ðŸŒŸ Please fill out this brief DHlab Postdoc Application Form, so I will not
     miss your application.
   * If your application materials are a good fit, I will reach out to you for a
     formal interview.

PhD Opening Details

 * Requirement
   
   * Being self-motivated and enthusiastic about AI for healthcare.
   * Have a good first degree in biomedical engineering, computer science, data
     science, applied statistics/ mathematics, or any-related field.
   * Strong problem-solving abilities and learning capability, such as top xx%,
     ranking xx out of xx, in your previous studies.
   * Proficiency in programming (Python, C++, etc) and in English reading &
     writing (requirements made by NUS: TOEFL/ IELTS/ GRE)
   * First-authored relative publication in top-tier journals and conferences
     are preferred.

 * Funding
   
   * You can see fundings such as:
     * A*STAR Singapore International Graduate Award (SINGA)
     * ASEAN Scholarship (only for students from ASEAN countries)
     * CSC Scholarship (only for visiting students from China)
   * For excellent students, we will recommend you to apply for scholarships,
     such as:
     * AISG PhD Fellowship
     * President's Graduate Fellowship (PGF)
   * More Ph.D. scholarship opportunities in NUS can be access here

 * How To Apply
   
   * Please send your CV, 1 page research statement, undergraduate transcripts
     (in English), and any other supporting materials, to lilei.sky@outlook.com.
     Email subject can be "PhD Application - Your University - Your Name".
   * ðŸŒŸ Please fill out this brief DHlab PhD Application Form, so I will not
     miss your application.
   * If your application materials are a good fit, I will reach out to you and
     encourage you to apply online in the NUS application system. Here are a few
     tips:
     * Apply for a PhD program rather than EngD.
     * For the source of finance, choose the NUS Research Scholarship or
       indicate any other funding you may have.
     * Be sure to select me as your proposed supervisor.
   * If you are a Singaporean/ PR, or you are willing to undertake a 3-year
     service obligation, i.e. work in Singapore after graduation, the admission
     bar may be slightly lower.

Other Research Positions Available

We are also welcome visiting students in our lab.

 * Application Process: Please refer to the instructions in the PhD section
   above for guidance on how to apply.

 * Internship Information:
   
   * NUS BS/MS/FYP Students: You are encouraged to register for research courses
     to demonstrate your commitment. Please note that typically, no funding is
     provided for these positions.
   * External BS/MS Students: Internship opportunities may be available for
     exceptionally outstanding candidates who express a strong interest in
     pursuing a PhD with us in the future.

Given the high volume of emails I receive, I may not be able to respond to all
applicants. Please understand that this does not reflect on your qualifications
or potential. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Biography#

Mr Wang Ruoxu is a undergraduate student in DHlab of NUS, supervised by Dr. Lei
Li. He is currently doing Final Year Project here. His research interests
include deep learning, medical data analysis and cross discipline research
interaction.

Biography#

Mr. Dongcheng Cang is a Year 4 undergraduate student in the Department of
Biomedical Engineering at the National University of Singapore (NUS). He is
currently working on his Final Year Project in the DHlab under the supervision
of Dr. Lei Li, focusing on physics-informed neural networks for modeling cardiac
electrophysiology. He is interested in modeling physiology, computational
biology, and data-driven approaches in biomedical engineering.

Biography#

Mr Fan Yang is a visiting PhD student in DHlab of NUS, supervised by Dr. Lei Li.
He received the master degree from Sichuan University (Chengdu, China) in 2022,
where he is currently pursuing the PhD degree with the College of Computer
Science. His research interests include multimodal learning, information fusion,
and computer vision.

Biography#

Mr Guang Yang is a DPhil student in University of Oxford (Oxford, UK),
co-supervised by Prof Vicente Grau and Dr Lei Li. He obtained his bachelor
degree in Department of Engineering, King's College London (London, UK) in 2022.
Later, he received his master degree from Department of Electronic and
Electrical Engineering, University College London (London, UK) in 2023. His
research interest is AI for cardiac analysis, specifically focusing on medical
image analysis, multi-modal deep learning.

of Informatics, Xiamen University, XMU (Xiamen, China) in 2023, co-supervised by
Prof Liansheng Wang and Prof Rongshan Yu. His research interest is AI for
cardiac analysis, specifically focusing on medical image analysis and
multi-modal deep learning.

Mr Hongcheng Han is a visiting student at the Department of Biomedical
Engineering, NUS, supervised by Dr Lei Li. He obtained a Bachelor of Engineering
degree from the School of Energy and Power Engineering at Xi'an Jiaotong
University in Xi'an, China, in 2020. Subsequently, he has been pursuing a Ph.D.
degree at the Institute of Artificial Intelligence and Robotics at Xi'an
Jiaotong University, supervised by Prof Shaoyi Du. His research interests lie in
AI-driven cardiac image analysis, specifically focusing on image-to-image
translation and multimodal fusion.

and managing our DHlab's website. He provides technical support to the team.

Biography#

Dr. Lei Li is an Assistant Professor of National University of Singapore (NUS).
Previously, she was a Lecturer at University of Southampton and a Postdoc at
University of Oxford. She received her Ph.D. degree in Shanghai Jiao Tong
University (SJTU) in 2021 and obtained the SJTU 2021 Outstanding Doctoral
Graduate Development Scholarship. She has been selected as the Rising Star of
Women in Engineering by Asian Deans' Forum 2023 and Featured Women in Science by
RSIP Vision. She serves as Board Member of SIG-Cardiac and Women in MICCAI (WiM)
and Area Chair of MICCAI 2024 and 2025. She is also the Guest Associate Editor
of IEEE Transactions on Medical Imaging (TMI) and Editorial Board Member of
Information Fusion. Her research interest is AI for healthcare, specifically
focusing on cardiac digital twins, medical imaging, and multi-modal AI.

Biography#

Ms Mengxiao Wang currently is a visiting PhD student in DHlab of NUS,
co-supervised by Prof Shuzhi Sam Ge and Dr Lei Li. She obtained her bachelor
degree in Shandong University in 2022. She is currently pursuing her PhD at
Shanghai Jiao Tong University (Shanghai, China). Her research interest is
multi-modal cardiac analysis, specifically focusing on digital twin modeling,
multi-sensor biosignal deep learning.

Mr Minghai Shi is a Master student at the Department of Biomedical Engineering,
National University of Singapore (NUS), supervised by Dr Lei Li in DHlab. He has

degree in Physics from Jiangxi Normal University in 2022. His research interests
focus on AI and deep learning for medical applications, particularly in visual
analysis and multi-modal learning.

Biography#

Mr. Shijie Wang is a Master of Biomedical Engineering student at the National
University of Singapore (Singapore). He obtained his Bachelor of Engineering
degree from Yunnan University (Yunnan, China) in 2022. His research interests
include AI in healthcare, particularly in medical image analysis, biomedical
signal processing (such as ECG), and the application of deep learning techniques
like Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) for developing robust diagnostic and
monitoring tools.

computer vision, especially those models that contribute to developing efficient
cardiac digital twins.

University of Singapore (NUS), hosted by Dr. Lei Li. He is currently an

camouflaged object detection, medical image segmentation, and polyp
segmentation.

Biography#

Xiaohan Yuan is a visiting PhD student at the DHlab, NUS, under the supervision
of Dr. Lei Li. She is currently pursuing her PhD at the VCL at Southeast
University, China. Her research lies at the intersection of computer vision and
medical imaging, with a focus on understanding cardiac structure, dynamics, and
function through image analysis to support personalized medicine and intelligent
diagnosis.

    Disease-Aware 4D Cardiac Cine MRI Images Generation. Asian Conference on
    Computer Vision (ACCV), 2024.

 2. Xiaohan Yuan, Cong Liu, and Yangang Wang, 4D Myocardium Reconstruction with
    Decoupled Motion and Shape Model. IEEE/CVF International Conference on
    Computer Vision (ICCV), 2023.

 3. Shitong Shao, Xiaohan Yuan, Zhen Huang, Ziming Qiu, Shuai Wang, and Kevin
    Zhou. DiffuseExpand: Expanding Dataset for 2D Medical Image Segmentation
    Using Diffusion Models. 1st International Workshop on Generalizing from
    Limited Resources in the Open World (IJCAI Workshop), 2023.

 4. Xiaohan Yuan, Cong Liu, Fu Feng, Yinsu Zhu, and Yangang Wang. Slice-mask
    based 3D Cardiac Shape Reconstruction from CT volume. Asian Conference on
    Computer Vision (ACCV), 2022.

 5. Xiaohan Yuan and Yinsu Zhu. A 2.5D Coarse-to-fine Framework for 3D Cardiac
    CT View Planning. Chinese Conference on Pattern Recognition and Computer
    Vision (PRCV), 2022.

Biography#

Mr Xiaoxian Zhang is a Master student at the Department of Biomedical
Engineering, NUS, supervised by Dr Lei Li. Previously, he worked as a data
scientist at the Beijing Community Research Center, developing community health
assessment algorithms. He is now undergoing hands-on clinical training in
radiation therapy procedures at Sun Yat-sen University Cancer Center (SYSUCC).
His research interest has evolved from AI-driven approaches to community health
governance toward applications in medical physics, with a current focus on
AI-assisted radiation therapy.

Miss Xiaoyue Liu is an undergraduate student at the Department of Biomedical
Engineering, NUS. She is participating in the CDE2605R Undergraduate Research
Program under the supervision of Dr. Lei Li. Her research focuses on the
intersection of deep learning and medical image analysis.

Miss Xicheng Sheng was a master student at the School of Data Science, Fudan
University (Shanghai, China), co-supervised by Prof. Xiahai Zhuang and Dr. Lei
Li. She obtained her B.S. degree in statistics from the School of Management,
Fudan University in 2022. She is passionate about exploring the intersection of
medical data analysis and healthcare innovation.

Mr Xingtao Lin is a PhD student in Fuzhou University (Fuzhou, China),
co-supervised by Prof. Xiahai Zhuang, Prof. Liqin Huang, Dr. Lei Li. He obtained
his master and bachelor degree in Fuzhou University (Fuzhou, China) in 2023 and
2019, seperately. His research interest is atrial fibrillation, with a primary
focus on improving the efficiency of diagnosis and treatment for this condition.
He is also concerned with how factors such as healthy eating, regular exercise,
and effective stress management impact heart health.

Biography#

Ms Xuan Yang is a PhD student in National University of Singapore (NUS) ,
supervised by Dr Lei Li. She obtained her bachelor degree in Information and
Communication Engineering from the Beijing University of Posts and
Telecommunications (BUPT) in 2022. Then in 2025, she earned her master degree
from the Shenzhen International Graduate School of Tsinghua University (THU).
Her research focuses on 3D+T cardiac digital twin technology and medical image
analysis, integrating dynamic temporal modeling with 3D cardiac structures for
clinical simulation and AI-driven diagnostic applications.

Biography#

Yanzi Wu is a Year 4 undergraduate student at the College of Biomedical
Engineering and Instrumentation Science at Zhejiang University. Currently, she
is working on her Final Year Project at the National University of Singapore
(NUS), in the DHlab under the supervision of Dr. Lei Li. Her research focuses on
4D torso-lung reconstruction based on medical imaging. Her research interests
include medical image processing, computational biology, and data-driven
modeling techniques.

Mr Yilin Lyu is a PhD student at the Department of Biomedical Engineering, NUS,
supervised by Dr. Lei Li. He obtained his master and bachelor degrees in Dalian
University of Technology (Dalian, China) in 2024 and 2021, respectively. His
research interests focus on cardiac digital twins (CDTs), including
high-fidelity 4D cardiac lesion reconstruction, accelerated electrophysiology
and electromechanical simulations to advance predictive, preventive, and
personalized cardiology.

Mr Zhen Li currently is a master's student in Biomedical Engineering at the
National University of Singapore (Singapore), engaging in research under the

research interests are in biomechanics, specifically focusing on
